plays.name: Smoking Is Bad For You
plays.notes: Short tragicomic monologue about an extremely henpecked husband. Needs a man of 50+ years.

plays.name: A Lonely Impulse Of Delight
plays.notes: Written as two men, but could be done genderblind. Excellent surreal short piece about a man who falls in love with a mermaid - initially comedic but turns dark. Reads as a metaphor for depression or anxiety. Ambiguously suicidal ending.

plays.name: Two
plays.notes: Collection of short vignettes giving insight into the lives of various individuals and couples who enter a pub over the span of an evening. Could be done as a complete collection, or could take scenes as excerpts. Very challenging as requires each actor to play 6 roles in rapid succession.

plays.name: No Exit
plays.notes: Iconic piece. Challening but extremely well-written, an exploration of the deepest flaws of three of the characters in the piece. Could be seen as slightly outdated in its presentation of gender roles, but these are also exposed for their fault. Very wordy, would require three versatile actors with a strong range of emotions. Chilling read.

plays.name: Living Hours
plays.notes: Deeply moving piece about grief, the arrogance of youth, the need to move on with life and struggling with mortality.

plays.name: King Arthur's Socks
plays.notes: Short comedy that modernises characters from Arthurian legend.

plays.name: Debit & Credit
plays.notes: Interesting short piece about climbing social ladders, the faults of aspiration, and familial ties.

plays.name: Fam & Yam
plays.notes: Very short piece about an established playwright, grown comfortable, and an upstart new playwright having an interview. Funny.

plays.name: The Grand Design
plays.notes: Deeply moving piece about communication, place, meaning of life, and the relationship between mother and son. Lighter tone than a lot in this list.
